qas.question: Economic distortion is created by corruption in the public sector by diverting what into capital projects?
What is more plentiful in capital projects?
Corruption can lower what with environmental regulations?

context: Corruption also generates economic distortion in the public sector by diverting <a0_0>public investment<a0_0/> into capital projects where <a1_0>bribes and kickbacks<a1_0/> are more plentiful. Officials may increase the technical complexity of public sector projects to conceal or pave the way for such dealings, thus further distorting investment. Corruption also lowers <a2_0>compliance<a2_0/> with construction, environmental, or other regulations, reduces the quality of government services and infrastructure, and increases budgetary pressures on government.
